description: Washington State Governor Jay Inslee joined the ranks of Democrats who are offering measured support for President Joe Biden’s reelection campaign, emphasizing the importance of keeping Donald Trump from returning to office.
title: Washington Governor Inslee Joins Democrats Tepidly Supporting Biden

description: Donald Trump asked a New York judge to toss out his hush money conviction because of the US Supreme Court ruling that presidents have at least some immunity from criminal charges, setting up a fresh fight with Manhattan prosecutors as his campaign to take back the White House heats up.
title: Donald Trump Asks Judge to Toss Hush Money Conviction Over Immunity Ruling

description: Jurors in the bribery trial of US Senator Bob Menendez are set to begin deliberations Friday after a two-month trial in New York federal court.
title: Bob Menendez Jury Set to Start Deliberations at Corruption Trial

description: President Emmanuel Macron sought to convince fellow NATO leaders in Washington this week that the political turmoil in France wouldn’t affect his ability to support the military alliance’s goals, particularly when it comes to Ukraine.
title: Macron Tries to Tamp Down Concern at NATO Over French Turmoil

description: In this Bloomberg Originals mini-documentary, we show how investors quaked at the prospect of a far-right government and what a political deadlock means for Europe.
title: How Macron’s Gambit Thrust France Into Economic Uncertainty

description: A Russian fishing boat is implicated in an attack on a data cable beneath the Norwegian Sea.
title: A Cable Under Norway’s Sea Disappeared. Was Russia to Blame?

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, deputy Congress editor Mike Dorning looks at the Democratic Party’s choices amid turmoil over President Joe Biden. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden’s Troubles Put Party to a Test of Loyalty Versus Pragmatism

description: Mexico’s President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum named a former top adviser to President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador as her chief of staff.
title: Sheinbaum Picks AMLO’s Former Adviser Cardenas as Chief of Staff

description: Turkey is scaling back a planned $23 billion defense contract with the US to modernize NATO’s second largest fleet of F-16 fighter jets and will seek an offset agreement to produce some warplane parts locally.
title: Turkey to Pare Back $23 Billion Deal for F-16 Jets With US

description: The US announced a new $225 million weapons package for Ukraine aimed at shoring up the country’s air-defense systems as deadly Russian missiles and drones continue to hit Ukrainian cities.
title: US Announces New Military Aid For Ukraine, Including Air Defense

description: The England men’s football team stands one game away from winning its first major tournament in almost six decades — and the opportunity couldn’t come at a better time for Britain’s new prime minister, Keir Starmer.
title: Football Glory Offers Fan-in-Chief Starmer a Narrative He Craves

description: Nigerian officials are demanding and receiving bribes to deliver public services, with people in rural areas paying more than those in urban centers, according to a survey conducted by the National Bureau of Statistics.
title: Nigerian Officials Took $1.3 Billion in Bribes in 2023, NBS Says

description: Italian Industry Minister Adolfo Urso said Stellantis NV should make “responsible” choices on jobs for its car plants and for local suppliers as the company unveiled a new Serbian-made Panda.
title: Italy Warns Stellantis as Automaker Unveils Serbian-Made Fiat

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau says Canada will hit NATO’s requirement to spend 2% of gross domestic product on defense by 2032.
title: Trudeau Says Canada to Meet NATO Spending Target by 2032

description: Some longtime allies and advisers to Joe Biden are working to come up with ways to persuade the president to end his reelection campaign, the New York Times reported, citing people briefed on the matter.
title: Some Biden Allies Discussing How to Get Him to Step Aside: NYT

description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni warned fellow NATO leaders not to lose sight of potential threats off the alliance’s southern flank, as most attention is being focused to the east.
title: Meloni Warns NATO of Threats from Russia and China in Africa

description: Group of Seven nations issued one of the more severe condemnations of Israel since the war with Hamas began in October, calling on the reversal of land seizures and legalization of outposts in the occupied West Bank.
title: G-7 Condemns Israeli Expansion in West Bank Not Seen in Decades

description: The head of the International Monetary Fund is standing by her top negotiator as the lender weighs the future of Argentina’s $44 billion program after President Javier Milei coyly criticized the official.
title: IMF Backs Negotiator Who Drew Milei’s Ire in Argentina Aid Talks

description: The new Labour government under Prime Minister Keir Starmer is looking to firm up a structure for the UK’s National Wealth Fund in time for an investment summit planned for the autumn, in a bid to showcase the initiative to an international audience.
title: UK Plans to Unveil Wealth Fund Structure at Global Investment Summit

description: The Pentagon will take deliveries of F-35 fighter jets again next week instead of continuing to wait for a crucial hardware and software upgrade that’s been delayed, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Lockheed Set to Resume F-35 Deliveries to Pentagon Next Week

description: US and German security services foiled a Russian plot to assassinate the chief executive officer of Rheinmetall AG, a German arms manufacturer producing weapons for Ukraine, people familiar with the matter said.
title: US and Germany Foiled Russian Plot to Kill CEO of Arms Manufacturer Rheinmetall

description: National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said negotiators have made progress toward an Israel-Hamas cease-fire, but tamped down hopes of a deal anytime soon.
title: US Says Gaza Cease-Fire Signs are ‘More Positive’ Than in Months

description: Half a dozen European Union countries are looking at ways to censure Hungary after Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s freewheeling diplomacy took him on visits to Russia, Ukraine and Mar-a-Lago, Florida.
title: EU Nations Push to Censure Hungary’s Orban Over Putin Meeting

description: Venture capitalist David Sacks will speak at the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee, highlighting the support from many prominent business leaders for Donald Trump in his rematch with President Joe Biden.
title: Investor David Sacks to Speak at Convention in Boost for Trump

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer emerged as Joe Biden’s chief defender at the NATO summit in Washington, saying the US president was “on good form” and “across the detail” in their White House meeting Wednesday.
title: Starmer Says Biden in ‘Good Form’ During White House Meeting

description: The US designated Venezuela’s Tren de Aragua gang as a transnational criminal organization that is expanding into the US.
title: US Sanctions Venezuela’s Most Feared Criminal Organization

description: The French government is planning to extend the country’s current unemployment benefit rules until September 30, Agence France-Presse reported Thursday.
title: France to Extend Current Unemployment Rules Until End Sept: AFP

description: The US Federal Trade Commission plans to delay its decision whether to block Chevron Corp.’s $53 billion takeover of Hess Corp. until after an arbitration case with Exxon Mobil Corp. is settled, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: FTC Delays Chevron-Hess Decision to After Exxon Arbitration

description: An initiative to deliver a million drones to Ukraine by next February is moving ahead as contributions from allies pile up, Latvia’s defense chief said.
title: Million-Drone Effort for Ukraine Is Moving Forward, Latvia Says

description: The late Silvio Berlusconi, Italy’s controversial multi-term prime minister, will join the likes of Leonardo Da Vinci and Marco Polo in having one of the country’s airports named after him, following a decision that has some Italians fuming.
title: Silvio Berlusconi’s Name Will Adorn a Major Milan Airport, and Opponents Are Fuming

description: France, Germany, Italy and Poland plan to design and build long-range missiles as Europe steps up efforts to strengthen its military capabilities.
title: European Nations Plan New Long-Range Missiles to Ease US Burden

description: Key Republican lawmakers asked the Biden administration to prepare a formal intelligence community assessment of a budding partnership between Microsoft Corp. and Abu Dhabi AI firm G42, with a focus on the Emirati company’s ties to China.
title: GOP Lawmakers Call for Intelligence Probe of Microsoft-G42 Deal

description: UK households have accumulated energy debts of £3.3 billion ($4.3 billion) even as bills ease, a reminder to the new Labour government that lower power and gas costs haven’t tempered the cost of living for many.
title: Britons Fall Further Into Energy Debt Even as Bills Come Down

description: President Joe Biden’s news conference at the NATO summit amounts to a make-or-break moment in his quest to quiet a drumbeat of concerns at home and abroad about his 2024 presidential campaign.
title: Biden’s 2024 Bid Faces Moment of Truth at NATO News Conference

description: In a broad overhaul of its post-crisis system for determining whether finance workers are up to the job, Ireland will interview more candidates and establish a dedicated unit to carry out the work following a sweeping review of the 14-year-old regime.
title: Ireland to Revamp Post-Crisis Probity Regime for Finance Workers

description: The US, Finland and Canada are teaming up to share shipbuilding expertise on icebreakers, expecting global demand for the vessels to grow as Russia and China increasingly make aggressive moves in the Arctic.
title: US, Finland, Canada Forge Icebreaker Ship Pact to Counter Russia, China in Arctic

description: Britain’s water industry is bracing for the biggest overhaul since privatization in the 1980s amid a scandal over systematic sewage spills and chronic pipe leaks. The crisis follows decades of poor regulatory oversight that allowed company owners to pay themselves billions of pounds in dividends instead of using the money to maintain the infrastructure. Things have got so bad that Thames Water Ltd., which serves about a quarter of the UK population, is being taken into special measures and could
title: Why Customers Will Pay the Bill for UK’s Water Crisis

description: Thames Water is set to be put in special measures by the regulator to try to get the beleaguered utility back on its feet before it runs out of money at the end of May.
title: What Will It Take to Bring Thames Water Back From The Brink?

description: Job growth in the UK’s digital industry hit its lowest in a decade, prompting the incoming Labour government to pledge to revive the sector as it seeks to stimulate growth.
title: UK Digital Industry Job Growth Falls to Lowest in Decade

description: Kenya’s President William Ruto dismissed most of his cabinet after deadly protests against his plan to raise more than $2 billion in new taxes.
title: Kenya’s Ruto Dismisses Most of His Cabinet After Deadly Riots

description: Support for President Joe Biden’s candidacy is cracking in one of the party’s key pillars: New York.
title: Biden’s New York Support Crumbles as Election Anxiety Mounts

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: A Week IS A Long Time In Politics: Tories Look To Rebuild

description: South Africa’s new health minister backed a recent law that will lay the groundwork for universal national health insurance, an indication of his party’s resolve to follow through with the controversial program despite having lost its parliamentary majority.
title: New South African Minister Backs Health Insurance Revamp

description: Asset managers offering ESG funds in Europe may need to offload close to $30 billion in stocks and bonds if they intend to hold onto the label under new rules, according to research by analysts at Barclays Plc.
title: Barclays Sees $30 Billion Selloff Risk Amid New EU ESG Fund Rule

description: Emmanuel Macron’s efforts to defuse the political crisis he created with a snap parliamentary election have elicited brusque pushback, underscoring the French president’s waning authority and highlighting deep divisions.
title: Macron’s Vision of a Centrist Alliance Is Already Faltering

description: Zimbabwe is rushing to ready itself for a new era of carbon trading under a United Nations framework that allows countries to buy and sell carbon credits from each other, as well as companies, to help meet their climate goals.
title: Zimbabwe to Widen Carbon Industry to Trade With Other Nations

description: France’s next government will need to find more than €15 billion ($16.2 billion) in extra revenue or savings a year to meet European Union demands, according to people with knowledge of the assessment.
title: France Must Find €15 Billion Annually to Meet EU Fiscal Demands

description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire is pressing ahead with planned spending cuts as he seeks to reassure markets and the European Union of the country’s fiscal credibility despite the political uncertainty over the next government.
title: French Government Readies Spending Cuts to Reassure Markets

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Hollywood and Democratic Royalty Turn on Biden

description: France’s snap legislative election has caused an unusually perplexing situation for a country more used to having a president whose government commands a majority in parliament to pass laws.
title: France Seeks a Premier Who Can Survive in the Job: What to Watch

description: Mali’s military government has allowed political activities to resume following a three-month suspension.
title: Mali Political Activities to Resume After Three-Month Suspension

description: South Sudan President Salva Kiir has fired Finance Minister Awow Daniel Chuang and the head of the state-owned Nile Petroleum Corp., Bernard Amour Makeny.
title: South Sudan President Replaces Finance Minister, Oil-Firm Chief

description: Spain’s government has proposed Digital Transformation Minister Jose Luis Escriva as central bank governor, El País reported, citing unidentified people close to the matter.
title: Spain Government Proposes Escriva as Central Bank Chief: Pais

description: A supplier of perfumes to Harrods is facing a criminal investigation after continuing to sell his high-value products to Russia, in a sign that luxury goods are still being sent to the country in breach of UK sanctions.
title: Harrods Perfume Supplier Arrested Over Luxury Sales to Russia

description: Chinese people are blaming inequality in the economic system for diminishing their chances at amassing wealth, as urgency builds for Beijing to revive confidence at a key policy meeting.
title: Chinese Lose Confidence in Meritocracy as Path to Greater Wealth

description: France cannot afford to keep increasing its deficit or burden its companies with more taxes and costs, Bank of France Governor François Villeroy de Galhau warned as political parties jostle to form the country’s next government.
title: Bank of France Chief Warns Next Government Not to Widen Deficit

description: South Korea is looking to develop and deploy laser weapons to bring down North Korea’s drones, as the military rivals on the peninsula ramp up their unmanned aerial vehicle programs.
title: South Korea Seeks to Deploy Lasers Against Kim Jong Un’s Drones

description: Russia declared The Moscow Times an “undesirable organization” for its reporting on President Vladimir Putin’s war in Ukraine, deepening the Kremlin crackdown on independent journalism.
title: Russia Bans Moscow Times as ‘Undesirable’ Over Reporting on War

description: China and India, nuclear-armed neighbors, have had thousands of troops facing off in a disputed region of the Himalayas since 2020, when skirmishes led to the first deadly clashes in four decades. New Delhi has hit back economically as well by blocking investment and curtailing access to the vast Indian market for Chinese tech firms especially. Several rounds of talks to resolve the dispute have made incremental progress. Any resolution likely would do little to affect broader geopolitical curre
title: How a Border Dispute Bedevils Ties Between India and China

description: On this week’s episode of In the City, we discuss Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ plan to kickstart growth.
title: How Labour Plans to Rebuild the British Economy

description: Thailand certified the results of the first Senate selection since a coup in 2014, with lawmakers linked to a conservative party emerging as the biggest group while those backed by Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin’s party trailed behind.
title: Thai Conservatives Win Most Senate Seats as Power Balance Set to Shift

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s embrace of Vladimir Putin on the eve of President Joe Biden’s pivotal NATO summit in Washington has frustrated US officials who have made closer ties with the Asian nation a cornerstone of their foreign policy.
title: Modi’s Embrace of Putin Irks Biden Team Pushing Support for Kyiv

description: China sent a record number of warplanes across a US-drawn boundary in the Taiwan Strait — a move that comes as the new president of the archipelago mulls a trip that may include a stop in America.
title: China Sends Most Warplanes Ever Across Key Line With Taiwan

description: Former President Donald Trump will meet with Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban in Florida on Thursday, according to people familiar with the matter, less than a week after he met with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow.
title: Hungary’s Orban Will Visit Trump in Florida After NATO Summit

description: Donald Trump will speak at a Bitcoin conference later this month, according to the event’s organizers, an address that would highlight his growing embrace of the cryptocurrency industry.
title: Trump to Address Bitcoin Event in Show of Support for Crypto

description: President Joe Biden called the UK the “knot” that ties the NATO alliance together as he praised new Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s efforts to forge closer ties with Europe.
title: Biden Welcomes Closer UK-Europe Ties in First Starmer Meeting
